OVERALL If you‚Äôre tired of companies like facebook reading your messages, yes they really do, it‚Äôs time to up your game. Telegram and Signal are both great apps, Telegram being a bit easier, and polished. Telegram chats use two modes. In standard mode messages are encrypted and stored on their servers. In ‚Äúpadlock‚Äù mode messages are encrypted and stored on your device. Both are secure, however in ‚Äúpadlock‚Äù mode if you, for instance, buy a tablet and install Telegram it won‚Äôt show your messages from other devices. Remember, enable touch ID on your phone/iPad/macOS device and Telegram, otherwise anyone could physically access the device and read your conversations. SUGGESTED IMPROVEMENT FOR DEVS It could use one improvement, when you share via iOS it needs to have both the standard AND a ‚Äúpadlock‚Äù icon for secure chat. We use the group video call feature to share screens and audio, and it‚Äôs very easy to seamlessly switch devices without having to disrupt the call. The iOS app seems more buggy than desktop as it overheats and freezes up my phone during long calls. Other bugs include recursive screen-in-screens during screen sharing, hearing your own voice when sharing audio, and suddenly not hearing the other person. The only thing I had done was to block the scammer on Telegram, but that wasn‚Äôt enough.
